Read and update or build the flights database for a site

Source: R/build_flights_db.R
build_flights_db.Rd

Reads any existing flights_.txt from flights directory for site, builds it or updates it for new or deleted files, saves the new version, and returns the path/name and table. Finds classes from pars.yml as case-insensitive underscore-separated words (after applying name fixes).

Usage

build_flights_db(site, refresh = FALSE, really = FALSE)

Arguments

site

Site abbreviation

refresh

Recreated database from scratch. Warning: this will destroy your existing database, including all assigned scores and comments. Requires also supplying really = TRUE.

really

If TRUE, allows refresh to recreate the database

Value

A list of

db

Site database table

db_name

Path and name of database table

Details

Files with changed timestamps are presumed to have been re-downloaded with gather (as stamps are set in processing). Files shouldn't be re-downloaded and replaced unless they've changed on the source, so these files have presumable been repaired. They are refreshed in the flights database, ready for re-screening.

On this page

Developed by Bradley Compton.

Site built with pkgdown 2.1.3.
